learning_outcomes.description: appropriately, safely, accurately, systematically and efficiently assess a client to determine and prioritise problems.
gather and interpret appropriate data related to the patient
demonstrate an appropriate process of clinical reasoning in making decisions related to the client such as developing a hypothesis, determining patient outcomes
apply problem solving skills such as critical thinking and judgment in the development of a treatment plan and in the selection and evaluation of specific interventions

develop and implement an effective and safe evidence-based physiotherapy intervention plan that is appropriate for the individual and prioritized in order to address assessment findings, while aiming to achieve client treatment goals
demonstrate an understanding of the presentation and management of a wide range of clinical problems across the lifespan
demonstrate an understanding of underlying principles and concepts of physiotherapy practice
demonstrate technical skill in the application of assessment and treatment techniques
evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of interventions by using appropriate re-evaluation and/or valid and reliable outcome measures
demonstrate ethical and professional decision making and behaviour
demonstrate a range of effective communication skills including verbal, nonverbal and written applied to all aspects of practice including interactions with clients, professionals and record keeping
demonstrate an holistic approach to physiotherapy management of patients, acknowledging individual differences
demonstrate an understanding of the importance of patient goal-setting and self-management for return to function, work and leisure activities
demonstrate an appreciation of the roles of other disciplines and participate as a member of an interdisciplinary/multiprofessional team including delegation to staff under physiotherapy supervision
demonstrate the integration of evidence based knowledge into the clinical setting
gain an appreciation of the diverse roles of physiotherapists and scope of physiotherapy practice
demonstrate an ability to reflect on own professional development and physiotherapy practice
